What a wonderful stay!! We loved our time at the Exchange.
My husband and I decided to take a mid-week escape and drive down from the Twin Cities to Winona to hike and visit with friends + family. We've stayed at different hotels and BnB's in Winona over the years, but the Exchange is the best of them all by far.
Finding the Exchange was very easy and smooth, just on 4th street close to downtown near the levee park. Access was simple - the electronic door codes worked first time, every time. Building was quiet and secure, with super beautiful historic details inside.
The unit itself is gorgeous! The windows are huge and let in so much light, especially because it's a corner unit, with great sunsets and views of the bluff. You feel like you're perched above the street in a really peaceful way. Beautiful floor and finishings throughout. Seriously comfortable bed!!!!
We will definitely be staying again. What an asset to Winona! If you can book this building for your stay - do it!

Excellent location with breathtaking views from every room on the main floor. Plenty of space for multiple families, although there are only 2 showers. Excellent communication with the owners; they had instructions and pointers for everything from check in to the fact that cell service can be spotty. Fully stocked kitchen, patio furniture, firewood, etc. to make the experience great. We had an issue with the A/C but I think it was just bad luck that we were the there the first time of the season the system was needed. Overall a good experience and fun weekend.
It did fall short of a five star experience for a few reasons. It's certainly hard to overlook the fact it was 85 degrees in the house when we arrived and the A/C was not capable of cooling the main floor below 78 until we had a night dip into the low 50s. Not many windows open, and you really don't want them open at night because there are loud trains that come through what seems like once an hour. If you don't like very firm mattresses you'd better bring some sort of pad with you. Definitely bring your own pillow, none are great. There is no range hood so the kitchen will get very smokey if any sort of pan frying is done. The grill was not functional, bring your own.
We paid $600 per night for 2 weekend nights...I think we kind of envisioned this large lavish estate with really impressive amenities. The view is nothing short of spectacular but the house itself is basically like taking an average middle class home and multiplying the space by 3.
